name: NPR
text:
The Trump campaign has spent over $20 million in efforts to make inroads with Black voters.

Polls show narrow improvement with some Black voters, particularly men. But experts are skeptical of how much impact it'll have.
https://t.co/JQTKTBgGtS

name: NPR
text:
A federal judge in Pennsylvania has blocked the Trump administration from outlawing U.S. transactions with TikTok.

While it's a setback for the president's push to ban the app, the threat to TikTok's existence in the U.S. has not vanished. https://t.co/g8fXzxGjPh

name: NPR
text:
New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern waited until Friday to disclose that she had voted "yes" to both propositions.

Many supporters of legalizing marijuana thought her endorsement would help the proposal, which voters narrowly rejected.

https://t.co/NLKomwXe7R

name: NPR
text:
New Sam Smith. The return of Busta Rhymes. A 20th anniversary edition from Outkast. Here are @nprmusic's picks for the best albums out this Friday.
https://t.co/FAMQWg2XJQ

name: NPR
text:
"Think of all of the people like John Lewis and Dr. King getting ready to walk across Edmund Pettus Bridge," says Cherie DeBrest, who will be working the polls in her Philadelphia neighborhood.

"If they can do that, I can show up at the polls and work."
https://t.co/SzzT2ImVWn

name: NPR
text: Nov. 15 — that's when states should be ready to give out COVID-19 vaccines, according to the CDC. But that's an aspirational date so far; there is still no vaccine approved for use, and there may not be one until later this year or beyond. https://t.co/1zxFrXz01F

name: NPR
text:
Philadelphia Police smashed an SUV's windows during protests on Monday and violently yanked out driver Rickia Young, 28, and a teenaged passenger — throwing them to the ground.

Her lawyers say officers then separated her from her 2-year-old son for hours.
https://t.co/pOrDySSzVg

name: NPR
text:
Kyle Rittenhouse, the 17-year-old charged with fatally shooting 2 men and wounding a third during a protest in Kenosha, Wis., was extradited to Wisconsin. A judge denied his request to stay in Illinois.
https://t.co/Fmeg6ufDPT

name: NPR
text:
The CDC's 40-page "Framework for Conditional Sailing" will replace its "No Sail" order for cruise lines, which expires at midnight Saturday.

Under these guidelines, it's not clear when cruises will resume.
https://t.co/56j1yLrKCq

name: NPR
text:
In all, 20 NBA arenas — and dozens more sports facilities — are being repurposed to support voting this year. That's being driven by players speaking out louder about voting than they ever have before. 
 https://t.co/vRnWfNzKod

name: NPR
text: It looked as if polio was well on its way to becoming the second-ever human disease to be eradicated. Then came 2020. https://t.co/vl26bT0Uv9

name: NPR
text:
Four years ago, President Trump won Wisconsin by less than 1 percentage point. This year is also expected to be close. 

@MorningEdition spoke with some voters there to hear more about what's motivating them: https://t.co/dOkXU47L5p

name: NPR
text: Wyoming is quietly using dark money to help keep coal plants open in other states, in a bid to preserve its coal-dependent economy. Ethics experts say they've never seen this before — and find it troubling. https://t.co/FKYRGVLVvz

name: NPR
text: An astonishing 14 million to 23 million Americans intend to relocate to a different city or region as a result of telework, according to a new study released by the freelancing platform Upwork. https://t.co/oKzSjaeSjo

name: NPR
NPR
text:
Our Iraq correspondent @janearraf tracked down a family whose son was killed by a Navy SEAL. “It's true Khaled was a criminal, but he was a prisoner," his father says. "America has civilization and development and humanity. Why did they do this?”
https://t.co/TjBPYB2cdA

name: NPR
text:
It's been more than eight months since the pandemic hit the U.S. economy like a wrecking ball. Millions are still out of work. How has it affected your job, your finances and your family?

Please share your story with us. https://t.co/lUIpZk2Q3S

name: NPR
text:
Trump vowed to end America's opioid crisis. Under his administration, overdose deaths flattened in 2018 — but then surged to new record levels in 2019.

And preliminary CDC data shows another big increase in overdose deaths in the first 4 months of 2020.
https://t.co/rYrpCZWFpI

name: NPR
text:
Archbishop Wilton Gregory will be the first Black American cardinal in the Catholic Church. He spoke to NPR about the historic nature of his position, polarization in the U.S. and the political issues that inform his work.
https://t.co/aJGdu7DUOu

name: NPR
text: RT @nprbooks: Whoooo, it's Halloween! I'm overriding the Weekend Robots today to bring you a few of our best creepy crawly reads -- beginning with our spine-chilling list of 100 great horror novels and stories: https://t.co/0LbZYSoyad https://t.co/5l2Djgmjvv

name: NPR
text:
As a struggling actor in 1962, Sean Connery managed to change pop culture forever in the first scene of his first lead role, when he introduced himself in Dr. No: 

"Bond. James Bond." https://t.co/BILwOemCWO

name: NPR
text:
RT @gringsam: How late will you need to stay up to know who won key states? How long to count mail ballots? Will state results look red at first and then turn blue? 

It depends, but this handy guide has some answers https://t.co/WjKd5RJWpT

name: NPR
text: RT @StoryCorps: Former Army Specialist Garett Reppenhagen, a Halloween enthusiast, remembers how he found a creative way to celebrate the holiday during a military deployment to Iraq. As heard on @NPRWeekend for our Military Voices Initiative. https://t.co/TZ8Kg772nn https://t.co/S8FvRWgxTu

name: NPR
text: For decades, Republicans have increasingly relied on the South for electoral wins and political power. With Florida, North Carolina, Georgia and Texas all in play this year, is the Southern Strategy finally breaking down? @gpbnews https://t.co/ev0wpQWm5t

name: NPR
text:
So far, more than 9 million people in the U.S. have been infected with the coronavirus.

Here's how much cases are up compared to 2 weeks ago:

📈 South Dakota: +61%
📈 North Dakota: +40%
📈 Montana: +27%
📈 Wisconsin: +38%
📈 Wyoming: +79% https://t.co/MFRaArVOpB

name: NPR
text:
RT @sarahmccammon: My latest from this morning’s ⁦@NPRWeekend⁩:

Proposition 115 would ban most abortions in Colorado after 22 weeks. : NPR https://t.co/zi93PFy5lO

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration has issued an executive order that would make it easier to fire thousands of federal workers — while allowing political considerations to affect hiring.

"Imagine every single agency undermined by political hacks," a critic warns. https://t.co/1wn9mSdDwX

name: NPR
text: At over 9 million cases, the U.S. leads the world's COVID-19 crisis. Find a country-by-country breakdown of new and total cases here: https://t.co/LS6T7eAMR6

name: NPR
text: With Election Day deadlines to receive mail in ballots for many states around the corner, data show the U.S. Postal Service continues to struggle to meet its own criteria for on-time delivery of first-class mail. https://t.co/fwhJkugJrw

name: NPR
text:
An American citizen who was taken hostage in Niger by "a group of armed men" has been rescued by U.S. special operations forces, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says. 
https://t.co/8rx0T299QA

name: NPR
text: The German system of highly subsidized child care is the norm across Europe. It might sound like a utopian option for many American parents today — but the U.S. government offered its own version 77 years ago. https://t.co/exMdf3wwfo

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Here's when to expect results in six key presidential states: https://t.co/jYS4yBkRN3

name: NPR
text:
Garett Reppenhagen sat down with his friend — whom he served with in Iraq — to talk about a Halloween costume that almost landed him in hot water: dressing up as his "surly" team leader, Sgt. Richardson. @StoryCorps https://t.co/NWxtMSLdd9
 https://t.co/5aknV9fDqU

name: NPR
text:
The U.S. recorded 99,321 new coronavirus cases on Friday. It's the highest single-day increase yet — a sentence likely to be repeated in the coming weeks, amid a third surge that's expected to dwarf the previous two.
In https://t.co/zkWnHDAZTr

name: NPR
text:
The U.S. recorded 99,321 new coronavirus cases on Friday. 

It's the highest single-day increase yet — a sentence likely to be repeated in the coming weeks, amid a third surge that's expected to dwarf the previous two. https://t.co/ilFGXLG1e1
